model-value.desc: v-model; When set as `YYYY-MM-DD`, the calendar will display the current view on this date. If empty, then it will be changed to the current date which will be emitted

mode.desc: Tells QCalendar (wrapper) which calendar component to use

view.desc: The type of calendar view to be displayed

dark.desc: Places a calendar in dark mode

bordered.desc: Places a border around the calendar

now.desc: This is the currently displayed date (highlighted). If not set, then the current date is used

weekdays.desc: The normal weekdays array looks like this `[0,1,2,3,4,5,6]` where 0=Sunday, 1=Monday, etc. A week that starts on Monday, would look like this: `[1,2,3,4,5,6,0]` and a 5-day workweek would look like this: `[1,2,3,4,5]`

no-aria.desc: Turns off automatical generation of aria labels for timestamps

no-active-date.desc: This controls whether the `q-active-date` css class is set when a user clicks on a date label (button)

disabled-days.desc: An array of string dates in the form `YYYY-MM-DD` that will be disabled. If an array is contained within the array with a start and end date, it will be treated as a range

disabled-before.desc: A date in the form `YYYY-MM-DD` where all dates before, and including, will be disabled

disabled-after.desc: A date in the form `YYYY-MM-DD` where all dates after, and including, will be disabled

locale.desc: Used to change the locale of the calendar

max-days.desc: The number of days to be displayed. Applicable only for custom-interval, scheduler and agenda views. Do not use with `week` or `month` views (set to 0 if setting the view dynamically)

short-weekday-label.desc: Displays the weekday label in short format. For instance, 'Monday' would become 'Mon'

sticky.desc: Turns on sticky resources and intervals

cell-width.desc: Sets day cell width and turns on sticky mode. Width must be css measurement

transition-prev.desc: When animated property is true, transition to use for previous calendar view

transition-next.desc: When animated property is true, transition to use for next calendar view

time-clicks-clamped.desc: Causes the returning timestamp time to be clamped to the interval it is in

drag-over-func.desc: The function to handle dragover events

event.desc: The event associated with the dragover

timestamp.desc: The timestamp object associated with the date and optional time (if an interval)

index.desc: The column-count index location of the start of the drag (only available if property `column-count` is set)

returns.desc: If the event was handled

drop-func.desc: The function to handle drop events

event.desc: The event associated with the drop

timestamp.desc: The timestamp object associated with the date and optional time (if an interval) of the drop

index.desc: The column-count index location of the start of the drag (only available if property `column-count` is set)

returns.desc: If the event was handled

no-scroll.desc: Turns off the internal scrollbar. Useful if you want to handle your own scrolling

column-header-before.desc: Turns on the column-header-before scoped slot

column-header-after.desc: Turns on the column-header-after scoped slot

column-count.desc: Applicable only for day view. Show the same day x number of times in columns. Scoped slots get this data as index in passed object

column-index-start.desc: Applicable only for day view. This is the starting index. This allows you to create a paging system (next/prev) when using column-count property

interval-height.desc: The maximum height in pixels for the interval height

interval-width.desc: The maximum width in pixels for the interval width

interval-style.desc: Gets called to provide custom styling of an interval

timestamp.desc: A timestamp object associated with the interval

returns.desc: A Vue style object

interval-minutes.desc: The number of minutes in an interval

interval-count.desc: The number intervals to use. If interval-minutes is set to 30 then you would set interval count to 48 – double that of regular

day-height.desc: The maximum height in pixels for the day height. Using 0 will make the rows variable height based on content.

day-padding.desc: Overrides the padding to be used for a day element. You can use any CSS padding format

day-style.desc: Gets called to provide custom styling of a day

timestamp.desc: A timestamp object associated with the day

returns.desc: A Vue style object

day-class.desc: Gets called to provide custom styling (via classes) of a day

timestamp.desc: A timestamp object associated with the day

returns.desc: A Vue style object of classes

min-weeks.desc: The minimum number of weeks to be displayed

short-month-label.desc: Makes the month label short. January becomes Jan...

no-default-header-btn.desc: Do not display the day button in the header

no-default-header-text.desc: Do not display the day text in the header

show-month-label.desc: Shows the month label - this occurs on the 1st of the month

show-day-of-year-label.desc: Show the day of the year - this occurs in the top right of each day element. If show-month-label is true, then that day is skipped

enable-outside-days.desc: By default, outside days are disabled in month view. Use the property to enable them.

no-outside-days.desc: Do not display the labels of outside days

resources.desc: An array of objects with a single key of label. You can add other keys if you like, which will be passed back on the appropriate scoped slots

resource-key.desc: The key from the `resources` object that will be displayed

resource-height.desc: The maximum height in pixels for the resource height

resource-style.desc: Gets called to provide custom styling of a resource

data.desc: The data passed to the function

timestamp.desc: A timestamp object associated with the interval

index.desc: The resource index

resource.desc: The resource object

returns.desc: A Vue style object

selected-start-end-dates.desc: An array of two dates in format `YYYY-MM-DD` for selection purposes. Interval-based calendars use `YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm`

hover.desc: Changes the style `selected-start-end-dates` selection when in `mini-mode`. Typically, set this to `true` on `mousedown` and `false` on `mouseup`

selected-dates.desc: An array of string dates in the form `YYYY-MM-DD` that will be selected. Interval-based calendars use `YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm`

mini-mode.desc: When `true` puts the calendar into mini-mode. When `auto`, then the property `breakpoint` is used to determine when the calendar will be put into mini-mode

breakpoint.desc: This property is used when `mini-mode` is set with `auto`

month-label-size.desc: This property is used change the size of the month label button. This property is ignored when `mini-mode` is set to true

left-column-options.desc: An array of objects used to add columns to the left side of the agenda. Each object must have an id and label key or define the id object key using the `column-options-id` and the label using the `column-options-label` properties. The value of the id should be unique for each object. The object is passed to slots

right-column-options.desc: An array of objects used to add columns to the right side of the agenda. Each object must have an id and label key or define the id object key using the `column-options-id` and the label using the `column-options-label` properties. The value of the id should be unique for each object. The object is passed to slots

column-options-id.desc: The key in the object to use for `left-column-options` or `right-column-options` properties to define the id, otherwise `id` will be used

column-options-label.desc: The key in the object to use for `left-column-options` or `right-column-options` properties to define the label, otherwise `label` will be used

input.desc: v-model; Emitted when calendar date changes

change.desc: Emitted when the calendar dates change. For instance, if in `month` view, the `start` contains the timestamp object for the 1st of the month, and `end` contains the timestamp object for the last day of the month. For week view it's the first day of the displayed week and last day of the displayed week

{start, end}.desc: The timestamp objects for the first and last valid date being displayed

moved.desc: Emitted when the date is moved

timestamp.desc: The timestamp object of the move. For instance, if in month view, this will be the timestamp object containing the 1st of the month

expanded.desc: Event occurs when hierarchial resources are expanded/collapses

resource.desc: The resource object that was toggle, check `expanded` property for `true` or `false`

mini-mode.desc: Event occurs when switching to/from mini-mode, when the `breakpoint` property is set to `auto`

value.desc: If switched to `mini-mode`, then the value is `true`, otherwise it is `false

days.desc: An array of timestamp objects representing all the days in the month for that weekday

index.desc: The index of the weekday

click-time.desc: Occurs on time area of the main slotted content

data.desc: The data passed to the function

timeDurationHeight.desc: Given a duration (in minutes), will return the css height value

duration.desc: The number of minutes for the event to calculate it's height

returns.desc: The height (in pixels) to be used for the event

timeStartPos.desc: Calculates the starting y position of the passed in time

time.desc: The time for which a position is needed in 24-hour format (HH:mm)

returns.desc: The absolute y starting position, but `false` on invalid time parameter

index.desc: The index of the column when using `column-count` property

resource.desc: The resource object associated with the event. Only applicable for resource views

prev.desc: Triggers component to display previous (ex: day, week, month)

next.desc: Triggers component to display next (ex: day, week, month)

move.desc: Triggers component to move for count iterations, depending on positive (forwards) or negative (backwards) value

count.desc: The amount of iterations to move (negative for backwards, positive for forwards). If value is 0, emits `today's date` to v-model
examples: -5 (moves 5 iterations backward - if in `month` view, this would be -5 months
5 (moves 5 iterations forward - if in `day` view, this would be 5 days

updateCurrent.desc: Update various values to be consistent with current date

timeStartPos.desc: Calculates the starting y position of the passed in time

time.desc: The time for which a position is needed in 24-hour format (HH:mm)

returns.desc: The absolute y starting position, but `false` on invalid time parameter

timeStartPosX.desc: Calculates the starting x position of the passed in time

time.desc: The time for which a position is needed in 24-hour format (HH:mm)

returns.desc: The absolute x starting position

timeDurationHeight.desc: Given a duration (in minutes), will return the css height value

duration.desc: The number of minutes for the event to calculate it's height

returns.desc: The height (in pixels) to be used for the event

timeDurationWidth.desc: Given a duration (in minutes), will return the css width value

duration.desc: The number of minutes for the event to calculate it's width

returns.desc: The height (in pixels) to be used for the event

scrollToTime.desc: When on an interval view, scroll to the passed in time (y position)

time.desc: The time in which to scoll to. If the time is already visible on the viewport, this function will have no affect.

scrollToTimeX.desc: When on an resource interval view, scroll to the passed in time (x position)

time.desc: The time in which to scoll to. If the time is already visible on the viewport, this function will have no affect.

head-day.desc: Replaces the complete internal day header

index.desc: The index of the iteration

miniMode.desc: If currently in mini-mode (applied to Month calendars only)

day-header.desc: index is added if using `column-count` property

index.desc: If applicable, the index of the column-header

day-body.desc: index is added if using `column-count` property

timeStartPos.desc: Calculates the starting y position of the passed in time

time.desc: The time for which a position is needed in 24-hour format (HH:mm)

returns.desc: The absolute y starting position, but `false` on invalid time parameter

timeDurationHeight.desc: Given a duration (in minutes), will return the css height value

duration.desc: The number of minutes for the event to calculate it's height

returns.desc: The height (in pixels) to be used for the event

day-container.desc: The container is everything below the headers, including the intervals

days.desc: An array of timestamp objects that are to be displayed in the container. This slot does not replace the container, but instead, allows you to add to it. Example: use css `position: absolute` to create a `current time` bar.

intervals-header.desc: Use to render items in the intervals header

days.desc: An array of Timestamp objects

interval.desc: index is added if using `column-count` property

timeStartPos.desc: Calculates the starting y position of the passed in time

time.desc: The time for which a position is needed in 24-hour format (HH:mm)

returns.desc: The absolute y starting position, but `false` on invalid time parameter

timeDurationHeight.desc: Given a duration (in minutes), will return the css height value

duration.desc: The number of minutes for the event to calculate it's height

returns.desc: The height (in pixels) to be used for the event

column-header-before.desc: Use to render items before the column header

column-header-after.desc: Use to render items after the column header

day.desc: Use to add items to the `day` rendering

outside.desc: true if the date is outside of the calendar month, but still displayed

day.desc: A timestamp for the day of the slotted content

miniMode.desc: true if currently in mini-mode. Handle if you have set mini-mode to `auto`

head-day-label.desc: Use to replace the head day label

timestamp.desc: A timestamp for the day of the slotted content

miniMode.desc: true if currently in mini-mode. Handle if you have set mini-mode to `auto`

timestamp.desc: A timestamp for the day of the slotted content

outside.desc: If this day is considered `outside` the current month

selectedDate.desc: If this day is a selected date (applicable only for mini-mode)

activeDate.desc: If this day is the currently selected date (v-model)

miniMode.desc: true if currently in mini-mode. Handle if you have set mini-mode to `auto`

month-label.desc: Use to replace the `month label`. Not applicable in `mini-mode`

timestamp.desc: A timestamp for the day of the slotted content

miniMode.desc: true if currently in mini-mode. Handle if you have set mini-mode to `auto`

day-of-year.desc: Use to replace the `day of year` label. Not applicable in `mini-mode`

workweekLabel.desc: The string for the workweek label

miniMode.desc: true if currently in mini-mode. Handle if you have set mini-mode to `auto`

workweek-header.desc: Scoped slot for the workweek header area

start.desc: A timestamp object representing the first day of the week

end.desc: A timestamp object representing the last day of the week

miniMode.desc: true if currently in mini-mode. Handle if you have set mini-mode to `auto`

week.desc: This is an array of timestamp objects. One for each day of the week to be displayed

weekdays.desc: The normal weekdays array looks like this `[0,1,2,3,4,5,6]` where 0=Sunday, 1=Monday, etc. A week that starts on Monday, would look like this: `[1,2,3,4,5,6,0]` and a 5-day workweek would look like this: `[1,2,3,4,5]`

miniMode.desc: true if currently in mini-mode. Handle if you have set mini-mode to `auto`

column-header.desc: Use this slot to add to the column header when properties `left-column-options` or `right-column-options` are used

data.desc: This is the object passed to properties `left-column-options` or `right-column-options`

column-body.desc: Use this slot to add to the column body when properties `left-column-options` or `right-column-options` are used

data.desc: This is the object passed to properties `left-column-options` or `right-column-options`

interval-label.desc: Use this slot to change the display of an interval label

interval.desc: The interval object for this label

index.desc: The interval index

resource-header.desc: Use this slot to add to the empty area above resources

intervals.desc: An array of timestamps for the intervals that will be displayed

resource-row.desc: This slot is the complete row, including resource and intervals

resource.desc: A resource object that was passed in within the array of resources

index.desc: The resource index from the array

resource-label.desc: Use this slot to replace the resource label

resource.desc: A resource object that was passed in within the array of resources

index.desc: The resource index from the array

resource-intervals.desc: Use this slot to place abosolute positioned events

resource.desc: A resource object that was passed in within the array of resources

intervals.desc: An array of timestamps for the intervals that will be displayed

timeStartPosX.desc: Calculates the starting x position of the passed in time

time.desc: The time for which a position is needed in 24-hour format (HH:mm)

returns.desc: The absolute x starting position

timeDurationWidth.desc: Given a duration (in minutes), will return the css width value

duration.desc: The number of minutes for the event to calculate it's width

returns.desc: The width (in pixels) to be used for the event

resource-interval.desc: Use this slot add to an interval for the specified resource

resource.desc: A resource object that was passed in within the array of resources
